{"step_by_step_thinking": "Hematopoietic stem cells are responsible for the formation of blood cells. According to Document [0], these cells are used in bone marrow transplantation, which suggests that they are found in the bone marrow. This is further supported by Document [26], which states that marrow contains hematopoietic stem cells which give rise to the three classes of blood cells found in circulation. Therefore, the origin of progenitor hematopoietic stem cells is the bone marrow.", "answer_choice": "A"}
